name: Constitutional amendments, proposed
text: [§11-118.5]  Constitutional amendments, proposed.  Any constitutional amendment proposed by the legislature shall include in final form the exact constitutional ratification question to be printed on a ballot.  The constitutional ratification question shall be phrased in a manner to enable voters to express their choice on the constitutional amendment by providing a "yes" or "no" response.  The language and meaning of a constitutional amendment shall be clear and it shall be neither misleading nor deceptive. [L 1996, c 173, §1; am L 1997, c 2, §17]
